name: GraphQl

types.name: Request
types.comment:
Requests contains the query or the mutation and the variables of each GraphQL requests.
The variables can't be used with an anonymous Request, due to the nature of GraphQL.

values.name: addVariables
values.comment:
Add variables to a request. Useful when defining variables in your GraphQL request.
If no variables has been defined in your operation, no variables can be added: the
compiler will reject it.

    named [ field "user" |> withArgument "id" (variable "id") ]
      |> withVariables [ ("id", "INT") ]
      |> flip (query "https://example.com") decoder
      |> addVariables [ ("id", Encode.int 12) ]
      |> send msg
values.type: List ( String, Json.Encode.Value ) -> GraphQl.Request a GraphQl.Variables b -> GraphQl.Request a GraphQl.Variables b

values.name: input
values.comment:
Generates an argument, to use with 'withArgument'.

    field "CreateUser"
      |> withArgument "user"
        (GraphQl.input
          [ ("first", (GraphQl.string "John"))
          , ("last",  (GraphQl.string "Doe"))
          ]
        )

Turns into:

    CreateUser(user: {first: "John", last: "Doe"})
values.type: List ( String, GraphQl.Argument GraphQl.Mutation ) -> GraphQl.Argument GraphQl.Mutation

values.name: int
values.comment:
Generates an argument, to use with `withArgument`.

    field "user"
      |> withArgument "id" (GraphQl.int 12)

Turns into:

    user(id: 12)

values.name: mutation
values.comment:
Entry of every GraphQL mutation to turn them into requests, which can be launched!

    object []
      |> flip (mutation "https://example.com") decoder
      |> send msg
values.type: String -> GraphQl.Operation GraphQl.Mutation a -> Json.Decode.Decoder b -> GraphQl.Request GraphQl.Mutation a b

values.name: named
values.comment:
Generates a Value with a name.

    named "MySuperRequest"
      [ field "user" ]

Turns into:

    MySuperRequest {
      user
    }
values.type: String -> List (GraphQl.Value a) -> GraphQl.Operation a GraphQl.Named

values.name: nestedInput
values.type: List (List ( String, GraphQl.Argument GraphQl.Mutation )) -> GraphQl.Argument GraphQl.Mutation

values.name: object
values.comment:
Generates a Value, from a list of fields.

    object
      [ field "user" ]

Turns into:

    {
      user
    }

values.name: query
values.comment:
Entry of every GraphQL query to turn them into requests, which can be launched!

    object []
      |> flip (query "https://example.com") decoder
      |> send msg
values.type: String -> GraphQl.Operation GraphQl.Query a -> Json.Decode.Decoder b -> GraphQl.Request GraphQl.Query a b

values.name: send
values.comment: Sends the GraphQL request! Generates a Cmd, to feed the runtime in your update.
values.type: (Result.Result Http.Error c -> msg) -> GraphQl.Request a b c -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg

values.name: string
values.comment:
Generates an argument, to use with `withArgument`.

    field "user"
      |> withArgument "id" (GraphQl.string "12")

Turns into:

    user(id: "12")

values.name: type_
values.comment:
Generates an argument, to use with `withArgument`.
Generate a type in GraphQL.

    field "user"
      |> withArgument "id" (GraphQl.type_ "INT")

Turns into:

    user(id: INT)

values.name: variable
values.comment:
Generates an argument, to use with `withArgument`.
You don't have to handle the $ sign.

    field "user"
      |> withArgument "id" (GraphQl.variable "id")

Turns into:

    user(id: $id)

values.name: withAlias
values.comment:
Adds an alias to a Field.

    field "user"
      |> withAlias "currentUser"
      |> withSelectors
        [ field "id"
        , field "first_name"
        , field "last_name"
        ]

Turns into:

    currentUser: user {
      id
      first_name
      last_name
    }

values.name: withArgument
values.comment:
Adds an argument to a Field.

    field "user"
      |> withArgument "id" (GraphQl.string "12")
      |> withSelectors
        [ field "id"
        , field "first_name"
        , field "last_name"
        ]

Turns into:

    user(id: "12") {
      id
      first_name
      last_name
    }
values.type: String -> GraphQl.Argument a -> GraphQl.Value a -> GraphQl.Value a

values.name: withSelectors
values.comment:
Adds selectors to a Field.

    field "user"
      |> withSelectors
        [ field "id"
        , field "first_name"
        , field "last_name"
        ]

Turns into:

    user {
      id
      first_name
      last_name
    }
values.type: List (GraphQl.Value a) -> GraphQl.Value a -> GraphQl.Value a

values.name: withVariables
values.comment:
Adds variables to an Operation.

    "UserRequest"
      [ field "user" ]
      |> withVariables [ ("id", "id") ]

Turns into:

    query UserRequest(id: $id) {
      user
    }
values.type: List ( String, String ) -> GraphQl.Operation a GraphQl.Named -> GraphQl.Operation a GraphQl.Variables
